senses.de: Something that is completed successfully because of effort and skill
senses.ex: Graduating from university was a great accomplishment for him.

Tips.title: Pride Signifier
Tips.description: Use 'accomplishment' to express pride in hard-earned successes, whether big or small.
Tips.example: Learning to drive was an accomplishment that gave her a new sense of freedom.

Tips.title: Professional Milestones
Tips.description: 'Accomplishment' often describes professional successes and important milestones in a career.
Tips.example: Receiving the 'Employee of the Year' award was a significant accomplishment in his career.

Tips.title: Personal Goals
Tips.description: Refers to personal achievements tailored to an individual's set goals or ambitions.
Tips.example: Completing the marathon was a personal accomplishment she had trained months for.

senses.de: The skills or qualifications needed to do something
senses.ex: His many accomplishments include fluency in three languages.

Tips.title: Skill Highlight
Tips.description: Emphasizes an individual's skills or qualifications as noteworthy.
Tips.example: Being a chess champion at such a young age is quite an accomplishment.

Tips.title: Cultural Talents
Tips.description: May refer to cultural or artistic proficiency, such as music or dance skills.
Tips.example: Mastering the piano concerto was a remarkable accomplishment for him.

Tips.title: Educational Achievements
Tips.description: Abstract accomplishments could imply educational or intellectual milestones.
Tips.example: Understanding quantum physics is a real accomplishment for any student.

Achievement.wordDefinition:
Achievement, on the other hand, typically refers to reaching a significant or important goal, often involving recognition or success.

In summary, accomplishments typically refer to personal goals or tasks, while achievements refer to broader successes with greater recognition or significance.

Attain.wordDefinition:
Attain means to reach a goal or desired outcome, often through sustained effort or hard work.

For example, someone might say they want to attain a certain level of fitness, meaning they want to work hard to achieve and maintain that level over time.

Accomplishment tends to refer to a specific achievement, while attain tends to refer to a broader, ongoing effort to reach a goal.

Completion.wordDefinition:
Completion refers to finishing or reaching the end of something. It emphasizes the final result of a task, rather than the process of achieving it.

Completion emphasizes the idea that a task or project has been brought to a conclusion.

Both words can describe achieving a goal, but accomplishment emphasizes the effort and personal feelings of satisfaction that come with achieving a difficult goal, while completion emphasizes the idea that a task or project has been finished.

Consummation.wordDefinition:
On the other hand, ‘consummation’ refers to the moment when something is completed or finalized. It is the point at which a process, a relationship or an event reaches its natural end.

For example, the consummation of a marriage is the point at which a couple engages in sexual intercourse.

The main difference between the two words is that ‘accomplishment’ emphasizes the process of successfully completing something whereas ‘consummation’ refers to the finalizing moment or the end-state of a process, relationship or event.

Feat.wordDefinition:
Feat also means achieving something noteworthy or impressive, but it specifically refers to an achievement that required great courage, strength, or skill.

Examples of feats might include climbing a mountain, breaking a world record, or performing a dangerous stunt.

Accomplishment is a broader term that can apply to a wide range of achievements, while feat is a more specific term that implies a more impressive or challenging accomplishment.

Both words can be used in a variety of contexts, from personal achievements to professional accomplishments or athletic feats.

Performance.wordDefinition:
Performance refers to the execution or delivery of a task or skill, often in a public setting.

It is usually used when describing how well someone did in a performance-based activity, such as music or sports.

In simpler terms, accomplishment is about finishing something, while performance is about how well you did it. Accomplishment is applicable when talking about achieving a particular goal, while performance is applicable when discussing how well someone did in a particular activity or task.

Realization.wordDefinition:
Accomplishment refers to the act of completing or achieving something, while realization refers to the moment of understanding or becoming aware of something.

Realization is often used when describing a more abstract or internal experience, such as realizing one's true passions or the impact of a certain event on one's life.

Accomplishment is the achievement of a task or goal, while realization is the moment of understanding or becoming aware of something significant.

Success.wordDefinition:
Accomplishment refers to something that you have done or achieved, while success refers to achieving a goal or reaching a positive outcome in a particular area of life.

For example, you might feel a sense of accomplishment after finishing a difficult project, whereas success might be measured in terms of achieving a certain grade on an exam or winning a competition.

Accomplishment is more focused on feelings of personal satisfaction, while success is often measured by external standards or achievements.

Overall, both accomplishment and success are important for personal growth and development.

Triumph.wordDefinition:
Triumph refers to a significant victory over an obstacle or opponent. It implies a more significant and impactful achievement.

Examples of triumph might include winning a championship game or overcoming a major personal obstacle, such as beating an addiction.

Accomplishment refers to successfully completing a task or goal, while triumph implies a dramatic and noteworthy victory over a challenge or obstacle.

Victory.wordDefinition:
An accomplishment is something that you have achieved or completed after some effort or hard work, whereas victory refers to a win achieved over an opponent or competition.

Accomplishment is applicable in personal or professional growth, such as learning a new skill or completing a project. Victory is applicable in sports, contests, or competitions where there are winners and losers.

Both words signify a sense of achievement, but accomplishment often refers to personal success while victory is the result of competing against others.

videos.Text: Like any personal challenge, whether it's running a race or finishing a long book, when we make it through to the end, we feel a sense of accomplishment. This is true even if we know we're not really in any danger. Our thinking brains may know the zombies aren't real, but our bodies tell us otherwise.

videos.Text: Escaping slavery; risking everything to save her family; leading a military raid; championing the cause of women’s suffrage; these are just a handful of the accomplishments

quotes.Text: I seriously feel like the best days are ahead, and I like the idea of getting to do everything I did before but with more knowledge, experience, and street smarts. There's a certain love, appreciation, and gratitude that you have at 40 that you don't have when you're younger, and it makes every accomplishment feel so much better.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jennifer Lopez

quotes.Text: Within the soul of America is freedom of mind and spirit in man. Here alone are the open windows through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit. Here alone is human dignity not a dream but an accomplishment. Perhaps it is not perfect, but it is more full in realization here than any other place in the world.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Herbert Hoover

quotes.Text: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
quotes.Title: Inventor
quotes.Name: Nikola Tesla

quotes.Text: All the breaks you need in life wait within your imagination, Imagination is the workshop of your mind, capable of turning mind energy into accomplishment and wealth.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.Text: I started reading about people of great accomplishment... and it dawned on me suddenly that the person who has the most to do with what happens in your life is you.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: Friend, there's no greater investment in life than in being a people builder. Relationships are more important than our accomplishments.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: Perhaps one of the most important accomplishments of my administration has been minding my own business.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.Text: Nothing builds self-esteem and self-confidence like accomplishment.
quotes.Title: Scottish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.Text: No matter what accomplishments you make, somebody helps you.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Wilma Rudolph
